About Me

I am a Ph.D. candidate in Economics at the University of Pittsburgh. My work typically aims at questions about individual behavior and beliefs in groups, using administrative panels and experimental methods.

I enjoy communicating both simple and complex concepts clearly and have a tendency to stray from under the street lamp.

Working Papers
Herding to the Polls

tl;dr. Voter turnout rates are higher in neighborhoods with more in-party members.

R & R at JEEA
Testing Models of Strategic Uncertainty

with Alistair Wilson and Emanuel Vespa

tl;dr. An index using the notion of risk dominance organizes cooperation across social dilemmas in the lab.

Well Excuse Me!

with Beatriz Ahumada, Yufei Chen, Neeraja Gupta, Kelly Hyde, Marissa Lepper, Will Mathews, Neil Silveus, Lise Vesterlund, Alistair Wilson, K. Pun Winichakul, Liyang Zhou

tl;dr. Three excuse-seeking behaviors replicate but show no relationship across domains.

The Lab vs. MTurk

tl;dr. Subjects in dynamic trust games respond to the behavioral factors and in the same ways in the lab and on MTurk.
